metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31810 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Ruby through 2.6.7, 2.7.x through 2.7.3, and 3.xthrough 3.0.1. A malicious FTP server can use the PASV response to trickNet::FTP into connecting back to a given IP address and port. Thispotentially makes curl extract information about services that areotherwise private and not disclosed (e.g., the attacker can conduct portscans and service banner extractions).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.5
ruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-5ubuntu1.5').
